bugs.title: CVE-2023-3550 mediawiki: stored XSS leads to privilege escalation [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-3550 mediawiki: stored XSS leads to privilege escalation [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-3550 mediawiki: stored XSS leads to privilege escalation

long_desc.thetext:
Mediawiki v1.40.0 does not validate namespaces used in XML files. Therefore, if the instance administrator allows XML file uploads, a remote attacker with a low-privileged user account can use this exploit to become an administrator by sending a malicious link to the instance administrator.

Reference:
https://fluidattacks.com/advisories/blondie/

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2240808]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2240807

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2240807,2240808

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2023-45360 mediawiki: XSS in youhavenewmessagesmanyusers and youhavenewmessages i18n messages [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-45360 mediawiki: XSS in youhavenewmessagesmanyusers and youhavenewmessages i18n messages [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-45360 mediawiki: XSS in youhavenewmessagesmanyusers and youhavenewmessages i18n messages

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.12, 1.36.x through 1.39.x before 1.39.5, and 1.40.x before 1.40.1. There is XSS in youhavenewmessagesmanyusers and youhavenewmessages i18n messages. This is related to MediaWiki:Youhavenewmessagesfromusers.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T340221

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2247804]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2247803

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated

bugs.title: CVE-2023-45362 mediawiki: diff-multi-sameuser ("X intermediate revisions by the same user not shown") ignores username suppression [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-45362 mediawiki: diff-multi-sameuser ("X intermediate revisions by the same user not shown") ignores username suppression [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-45362 mediawiki: diff-multi-sameuser ("X intermediate revisions by the same user not shown") ignores username suppression

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in DifferenceEngine.php in MediaWiki before 1.35.12, 1.36.x through 1.39.x before 1.39.5, and 1.40.x before 1.40.1. diff-multi-sameuser (aka "X intermediate revisions by the same user not shown") ignores username suppression. This is an information leak.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T341529

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2247806]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2247805

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-51704 mediawiki: group-.*-member messages are not properly escaped on Special:log/rights [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-51704 mediawiki: group-.*-member messages are not properly escaped on Special:log/rights [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-51704 mediawiki: group-.*-member messages are not properly escaped on Special:log/rights

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.35.14, 1.36.x through 1.39.x before 1.39.6, and 1.40.x before 1.40.2. In includes/logging/RightsLogFormatter.php, group-*-member messages can result in XSS on Special:log/rights.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T347726
https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/thread/TDBUBCCOQJUT4SCHJNPHKQNPBUUETY52/

Fedora 40 Fail To Build From Source Tracker

Reproducible: Always

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 39 development cycle.
Changing version to 39.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 40 development cycle.
Changing version to 40.

php-oojs-oojs-ui failed to build from source in Fedora rawhide/f40

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=112369433


For details on the mass rebuild see:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_40_Mass_Rebuild
Please fix php-oojs-oojs-ui at your earliest convenience and set the bug's status to
ASSIGNED when you start fixing it. If the bug remains in NEW state for 8 weeks,
php-oojs-oojs-ui will be orphaned. Before branching of Fedora 41,
php-oojs-oojs-ui will be retired, if it still fails to build.

For more details on the FTBFS policy, please visit:
https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fesco/Fails_to_build_from_source_Fails_to_install/

bugs.title: mediawiki:  XSS in edit summary parser [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: mediawiki:  XSS in edit summary parser [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: mediawiki:  XSS in edit summary parser

long_desc.thetext:
Mediawiki security releases 1.39.7, 1.40.3 and 1.41.1, includes fix for cross site scripting vulnerability in edit summary parser. CVE assignment is still pending. 

References:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T355538
https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/wikitech-l@lists.wikimedia.org/thread/V3WXEPXV2DU6WTVEKK4XHW4QXD5OFKD7/

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2278773]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272577

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated

bugs.title: mediawiki: denial of service via GET request to Special:MovePage [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: mediawiki: denial of service via GET request to Special:MovePage [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: mediawiki: denial of service via GET request to Special:MovePage

long_desc.thetext:
Mediawiki security releases 1.39.7, 1.40.3 and 1.41.1. This includes a fix for a denial of service that occurs when a user opens Special:MovePage for a page containing a large number (tens of thousands) of subpages. Due to excessive queries used to create the list of subpages the maximum request time will be exceeded.

References:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T357760
https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/wikitech-l@lists.wikimedia.org/thread/V3WXEPXV2DU6WTVEKK4XHW4QXD5OFKD7/
CVE is still pending

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272578

Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:

FEDORA-2024-2c564b942d (mediawiki-1.41.1-1.fc40, php-oojs-oojs-ui-0.48.1-1.fc40, and 2 more) has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

An issue was discovered in includes/CommentFormatter/CommentParser.php in MediaWiki before 1.39.7, 1.40.x before 1.40.3, and 1.41.x before 1.41.1. XSS can occur because of mishandling of the 0x1b character, as demonstrated by Special:RecentChanges#%1b0000000.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T355538

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2279230]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2279229

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-2c564b942d (mediawiki-1.41.1-1.fc40, php-oojs-oojs-ui-0.48.1-1.fc40, and 2 more) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-2c564b942d

FEDORA-2024-2c564b942d (mediawiki-1.41.1-1.fc40, php-oojs-oojs-ui-0.48.1-1.fc40, and 2 more) has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

An issue was discovered in includes/specials/SpecialMovePage.php in MediaWiki before 1.39.7, 1.40.x before 1.40.3, and 1.41.x before 1.41.1. If a user with the necessary rights to move the page opens Special:MovePage for a page with tens of thousands of subpages, then the page will exceed the maximum request time, leading to a denial of service.

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T357760

bugs.title: CVE-2024-34500 mediawiki: XSS through interface message in UnlinkedWikibase [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-34500 mediawiki: XSS through interface message in UnlinkedWikibase [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-34500 mediawiki: XSS through interface message in UnlinkedWikibase

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in the UnlinkedWikibase extension in MediaWiki before 1.39.6, 1.40.x before 1.40.2, and 1.41.x before 1.41.1. XSS can occur through an interface message. Error messages (in the $err var) are not escaped before being passed to Html::rawElement() in the getError() function in the Hooks class.

https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/UnlinkedWikibase/+/1002175
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T357203

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2279234]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-34502 mediawiki: MergeLexemes makes edits on GET requests without edit tokens [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-34502 mediawiki: MergeLexemes makes edits on GET requests without edit tokens [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-34502 mediawiki: MergeLexemes makes edits on GET requests without edit tokens

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in WikibaseLexeme in MediaWiki before 1.39.6, 1.40.x before 1.40.2, and 1.41.x before 1.41.1. Loading Special:MergeLexemes will (attempt to) make an edit that merges the from-id to the to-id, even if the request was not a POST request, and even if it does not contain an edit token.

https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/extensions/WikibaseLexeme/+/1013359
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T357101

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2279239]
